findings.title: UCWNV - Unsigned Comparison with Negative Values
findings.description: The codebase contains unsigned expressions that are being compared with negative values. Such comparisons can lead to unexpected and erroneous behavior due to the nature of unsigned data types, which cannot represent negative values.

findings.title: EEC - Enhancing Explicit Constructors
findings.description: The codebase contains instances where a class has a constructor with a single argument that lacks the 'explicit' keyword, leading to unintended type conversions and potentially introducing ambiguity in code behavior.

findings.title: LCPC - Legacy C-Style Pointer Casting
findings.description: The codebase is using C-style pointer casting which can introduce potential type-related issues and compatibility concerns.

findings.title: PPBCR - Parameter Passed by Const Reference
findings.description: The codebase contains function parameters that are passed by value when they could be more efficiently passed by const reference, potentially leading to unnecessary memory consumption and performance overhead.

findings.title: DE - Duplicate Expressions
findings.description: This finding identifies instances within the code where the same expression or sub-expression is duplicated on both sides of a logical or relational operator.

findings.title: LVS - Local Variable Shadowing
findings.description: Local variable shadowing occurs when a new variable declared within a nested scope shares the same name as a variable in an enclosing scope.

findings.title: ITOFC - Invariant True or False Conditions
findings.description: The codebase contains specific conditions that are identified as either perpetually true or perpetually false based on the context in which they are evaluated.

findings.title: OVS - Optimizing Variable Scope
findings.description: Refine variable scopes to enhance code clarity and maintainability by minimizing scope of variables to the narrowest context where they are needed, reducing risk of unintended side effects and improving code readability.

findings.title: ECR - Enhancing Const References
findings.description: The codebase uses variables initialized but not modified without declaring them as const, which can lead to inadvertent alterations and reduced code clarity.

findings.title: USA - Using STL algorithms
findings.description: The repository is using row loops instead of the Standard Template Library (STL) algorithms, which can introduce challenges in code readability, maintainability, and reliability.
